result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick D Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically cognitive intervention. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Employment includes caring for his mother as long as a 1099 is provided and defendant files taxes every year. Must be complaint with family court/child support obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless previously provided and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick D Gordon

records.addlTxt:
Ct 1: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS: DEFENDANT IS TO BE TESTED AT LEAST TWICE A WEEK AS WELL AS RANDOMLY. DEFENDANT IS TO BE COMPLIANT WITH ALL CONDITIONS OF BOND WITH NO EXCEPTION. DEFENDANT IS TO MAKE PAYMENTS TO ZCI.

Defendant Patrick D Gordon in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Defendant Patrick D Gordon in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
P-G
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Parties stipulate to modification of bond. If there are any violations of conditions of bond, the State is not bound by the plea agreement stated here. Parties stipulate to modify bond to signature bond. Must make payments at ZCI and be randomly tested.


BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered. Modify bond to signature bond. Defendant to be tested twice a week as well as randomly by ZCI. Defendant is to be compliant with ALL conditions of bond with no exception. Defendant is to make payments to ZCI.
